intro: Mesembryanthemum incurvum, commonly known as the curled mesem, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptive features for arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in full sun and low water conditions. Its leaves are often bluish-green with a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers, which appear in late spring, are small and yellowish, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
